alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 5:08PM EDT until April 12 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Broward County in southeastern Florida... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated nearly stationary thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen from these thunderstorms. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Hallandale, Miami Gardens, Aventura, Sunny Isles Beach, West Park, Miramar Parkway And University Drive, Pembroke Park, Golden Beach and Hollywood Downtown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
